title: Developing the Business Structure Database (BSD) as a tool to support sub-national business policy analysis in the UK
abstractText:
There is an urgent need for a firmer sub-national evidence base on which to ground the development and refinement of growth-oriented business support measures and this project is designed to address that need.

The project has three main objectives:

  1. to provide new sub-national key indicators on job creation and destruction and high-growth firms for a range of end users including the English Local Enterprise Partnerships  and the three Devolved Administrations
  2. to create a resource which will allow academics and policymakers to investigate patterns of local economic development and growth, and undertake evaluations of policy interventions
  3. and to achieve these two objectives, a new database will be constructed which integrates data on firms with their constituent component establishments (plants) providing comprehensive geographically referenced data for all UK businesses.

The overarching objective is to make the Business Structure Database (BSD), which holds information on employment and sales for all UK registered firms, more useful for analysing sub-national economic performance.
